Reviews.Title: not a new phone.
Reviews.Author: alberto
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone because I was trying to get a unlocked galaxy express the phone arrived on time, but this phone was not new the back label where the phone info is,under the battery  part of that was cut and they tried to glue it back in place, they had done some repair on the phone got it from tablet distributors I sent the phone back for a refund what a waste of time, now just have to wait for refund.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Express i437 unlocked
Reviews.Author: Michael Delano "radar man"
Reviews.Content: I've pretty much have been a " flip " phone user during my cell phone life or a regular cell phone user since they first came out years ago. My previous flip phone which still works is the Motorola Tundra which I am considering going back to but not for reasons you might think. The major reason is that I am on a limited income and the cost of a flip phone vs. the smart phone is the difference of night and day. I pay about 45.00 dollars a month for my flip phone and the service price doubles to triples depending on your data plan with my " Major " service provider. So for 80.00 dollars or more per month I can keep my Smart phone running as long as I pay the bill. But with services like Straight Talk Net 10 or other compatible service provider out there the cost could be cheaper although you get what you pay for and sometimes that might not be a good thing. Now the better news. I have no complaints about the Samsung Express phone but keep in mind this is my first smartphone so I am very smartphone stupid. It is a nice phone and I do like it. It serves the purpose for me as I don't text that much or use the data as I am still trying to figure out just how to run this contraption. If you want or need more memory, then you can but one o them new fangled chips and put in the slot built for it. This phone is relatively easy to use if your knowledgeable with the smart phone world. The main reason I bought it is that it is an unlocked phone so if I finally get pissed off enough with my current carrier, I can take it to another GSM carrier of my choice that has the same system type that I am on and WHA LA, I have a cheaper bill with the same amount of service or more service for less price and bear in mind that this is an option that one has when they buy an unlocked phone.I have owned 3 different unlocked phone. The Motorola Razor, the Motorola Tundra, and now the Samsung Galaxy Express. I have never had a problem with the first 2 with the exception of the age of the phone vs. newer technology. I am very happy with both of the first 2 and both currently work well to this day.  But technology changes so one must at least try to go with the flow of things.If you like the Smart phone, I would have no problem in recommending this phone. For a person like me who is not smart phone savvy, it might take a few times to get hold of the ropes of figuring this new fangled contraption out, but that's why we have you young'uns around to help use older generation old timer folks out. LOL But if your knowledgeable in the smartphone world, then I say go for the gusto and get one if you don't need all the bells and whistles.I also purchased an HHI Hybrid Dual Armored Case that has a flip out piece on the back of the case which helps the phone stand in an upright position and it comes with a stylus pen which attaches to the phone and I put a "invisible Shield" screen protector by "Zagg" on the front of the phone to help protect the screen.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Recommend!!!
Reviews.Author: Dominic Pereira
Reviews.Content: Great phone.Pros:  Good price, good battery life, 4G LTE, good signal strength, good call quality, good features.Cons:  Cannot remove unwanted ATT application.

Reviews.Title: For my wife
Reviews.Author: Jaross "jaross"
Reviews.Content: She likes it very much. However, 4 stars as it does not have the FM radio built in. Battery life is very good. She is using it for gps tracking when she skies and it lasts for the entire day. Without tracking, it works for days. It comes with ATT preinstalled trashsoft, but you can hide it somehow. Also, swipe is preinstalled which is good.

Reviews.Title: The best medium price range high speed internet phone!
Reviews.Author: Paul "wds"
Reviews.Content: One flawless phone with no complaints I found, is this one.(1) This phone has Android 4.0 OS with no glitches, smooth loading. It only takes 8 seconds to turn on (from the time you press the power button and to go to the main screen).(2) Comes with 8GB of built-in memory (available 5GB for users)(3) Camera produces excellent pictures (both front and back)(4) Battery gives good power back up(5) Neither too small, nor too big(6) Touchscreen behaves the way it is supposed to(7) 1.5 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon S4 Plus MSM8960 dual-core process is awesomeThe reasonable price for this kind of phone could be around $150 to $175 range. This phone is little pricier.No complaints and only compliments instead for this phone. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: RonS
Reviews.Content: Phone is terrific. The unlocked phone allows me to use with numerous carriers, and change when I want. By changing SIM card I can also use in Mexico. Large screen makes it easy to use, even when I forget my glasses.

Reviews.Title: Very nice cell phone
Reviews.Author: Miguel Jimenez "Migi"
Reviews.Content: Very nice cell phone, has all require functionality and is very fast in all applications.  It has not to be hide behind the top actual cell phones.

ProductInfo.Features:
GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900, 3G: HSDPA 850 / 1900 / 2100, 4G: LTE 700 MHz Class 17 / 1700 / 2100
Android OS, v4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich), upgradable to v4.1 (Jelly Bean)
Chipset: Qualcomm MSM8960 Snapdragon, CPU: Dual-core 1.5 GHz Krait, GPU: Adreno 225
5MP (2592 х 1944) pixels w/ autofocus, LED flash, Geo-tagging, touch focus, face detection + front-facing 1.3MP Camera, Video: 720p@30fps
8 GB (5 GB user available), 1 GB RAM + microSD slot expandable up to 32 GB
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung Galaxy Express I437 Unlocked GSM Phone with 4G, Android 4.0 OS, Dual-Core Processor, 4.5" Super AMOLED Multi-Touchscreen, 5MP Camera, GPS, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, NFC and microSD Slot - Black
